CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 32, reads: "E. L. Smith, Builder, From Blueprint To New Community - New Homes Are News - Few Pittsburgh Negroes have ever had the privilege of living in a new home. Within recent years, E. L. Smith has built more new homes for Negroes than any other local building contractor. Operating principally on the East End - Penn Township sector, he has sparked the emergence of a new community in this area.  Here our photographer has taken pictures of phases of the Smith operation, as he converts raw land into a setting for graceful living. - Harris Photos."  "Good Managers - Here Edgar Lee Smith and his bookkeeper, his daughter, Alene, are preparing a payroll."
TitMainTitle: Alene Smith writing in ledger and seated next to her father, Edgar Lee Smith, behind desk, in interior with floral curtains
